div.l: What schall we speke all day of holy writte
The deuyll made a Reue for to preche
Or of a souter a schipman or a leche
Saie forth thi tale ⁊and tarie noght the tyme
Lo depeforde ⁊and it is halfweie pryme
Lo Grenewicche that many a schrewe is yn
It were all tyme thi tale for to gyn
Now sires ꝙquod this Osewolde the Reue
I praie you alle that ye nought you greue
Thogh I answer ⁊and somdell sette his hōuwe houwe hōun
For leueful is with force · force of schōuwe schouwe schōun
This dronken Miller hath tolde vs here
How that bigiled was a Carpentere
ꝐParauenture in scorn for I am oon
And be your leue I schall hym quyte a noon
Right in his cherlis termes will I speke
I pray to god his necke mote to breke
He can well in myn ye seen a stalke
But in his owne he can nought seen a balke
Here endeth the Prolog ·
⁊and begynneth the Tale
At Trompyngton nouȝt fer fro Cam bryggeCan bryggeCambryggeThe original reading cannot be seen, but was probably Cant + vowel; see line 2.

Ther goth a broke ⁊and ouer that a brugge The "u" of "brugge" is subpuncted: presumably noting the off rhyme the scribe has created. It is not impossible that "the "y" of Cambrygge in line 1 began as a "u.".
Vp on the whiche broke ther stant a Melle
And this is verraie soth that I you telle
A Miller was there dwellyng mony a day
As any pecok he was proude ⁊and gay
Pipen he couthe ⁊and fischen ⁊and nettis bete
And torne coppes ⁊and well wrastle ⁊and schete
Ay bi his belt he bare a longe panade
And of a swerde full trenchant was the blade
A ioly popperpoperpopper bar he in his pouche
Ther was no man for ꝑperill durste hym touche
A scheffelde thwytell bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face ⁊and camuse was his nose
As piled as an ape was his sculle
He was a markat betere atte fulle
Ther was no wight that durste honde on hym legge
But if he swore he scholde a noon a begge
A thef he was for sothe of corn ⁊and mele
And that a slye ⁊and vsant for to stele
His name was hoten deynous Symkyn
A wif he hadde comen of noble kyn
The ꝑperson of the toun hir fadir was
With hir he yaf ful many a pānne of bras
For that Symkyn schulde in his blood allye
Sche was fostred in a Nonnerye
For Symkyn wolde no wif as he seide
